skill.name: architecture-patterns
skill.description: Implement proven backend architecture patterns including Clean Architecture, Hexagonal Architecture, and Domain-Driven Design. Use when architecting complex backend systems or refactoring existing applications for better maintainability.
skill.summary: Implement proven backend architecture patterns including Clean Architecture, Hexagonal Architecture,...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill contains only documentation and code examples with no executable functionality, file access, network calls, or system interactions. It's purely educational content.

content.value_statement: Many backend systems become hard to change and test. This skill gives clear architecture patterns and examples to improve maintainability.
actual_capabilities: Explain Clean Architecture layers and dependency rules
Describe Hexagonal Architecture ports and adapters
Outline DDD strategic and tactical patterns
Provide sample directory structure for clean architecture
List best practices and common pitfalls
limitations: Does not provide runnable project code
Examples are focused on Python style and concepts
Does not include deployment or infrastructure guidance

use_cases.title: Refactor a monolith
use_cases.description: Plan a stepwise refactor toward clean layers and interfaces.

use_cases.title: Set team standards
use_cases.description: Define shared architecture rules and naming conventions.

use_cases.title: Design new service
use_cases.description: Choose patterns and boundaries for a new backend service.

prompt_templates.title: Choose a pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend an architecture pattern for a new backend service with a small team and evolving requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Map layers
prompt_templates.prompt: Map my current modules into clean architecture layers and suggest missing interfaces.

prompt_templates.title: Define bounded contexts
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify bounded contexts for an ecommerce platform and list candidate context maps.

prompt_templates.title: Plan adapters
prompt_templates.prompt: Design ports and adapters for payments and notifications in a hexagonal architecture.

output_examples.input: Suggest how to structure a clean architecture backend for user management.
output: Layers: entities, use cases, adapters, infrastructure
Core entities: User, Email value object
Use cases: create user, deactivate user

best_practices: Define small, focused interfaces for ports
Keep business logic in the domain layer
anti_patterns: Letting ORM models leak into core
Using clean architecture for trivial CRUD apps

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides guidance that works across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of the examples?
faq.answer: Examples are conceptual and not complete runnable projects.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing frameworks?
faq.answer: It describes patterns that can be adapted to most backend frameworks.

faq.question: Does it access my data or environment?
faq.answer: No, it contains only static guidance and examples.

faq.question: What if my project is too small?
faq.answer: It warns against over engineering and suggests simpler approaches.

faq.question: How does it compare to a full reference guide?
faq.answer: It is a concise pattern guide, not a full book or framework manual.
